news_header: A man who ignited protests by burning the Quran has been shot dead in Sweden.
news_text: Salwan Momika, a 38-year-old Iraqi man living in Sweden, was shot dead in Södertälje after sparking violent protests by burning the Quran outside Stockholm Central Mosque in 2023. Following his actions, unrest occurred, leading to arrests and diplomatic tensions. Momika had been charged with 'agitation against an ethnic group' and was awaiting a verdict when he was killed. The Swedish police had allowed his protest under free-speech laws, but the government is considering legal changes regarding such protests.
